Dear SHANTHEIS MOODY:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
September 4, 2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the WOC area manager, Shay Mavis, at (269) 243-2725.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(3) An agency shall provide the licensee an application
for renewal of the license and document the action not
less than 60 calendar days before the expiration date of
the license. A renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending recommendation for
disciplinary action of the license.
One of eight open foster home files reviewed did not have the renewal application
sent at least 60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license as required.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(3) An agency shall complete a special evaluation within
45 calendar days after receipt of the information. If
additional time is required, then the agency shall inform
the foster parent, in writing, of the basis for the extension
and the expected length of the extension. The total time
for the completion of the investigation may not exceed 90
calendar days without written approval from the chief
administrator or his or her designee.
One of four special investigation reports reviewed was not completed within 90 days
and did not have written approval from the chief administrator.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all
the following information:
2

• (a) The date the information was received.
Two of four special investigation reports reviewed did not have the written report
completed within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation as required.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(2) An agency shall maintain a file documentation from
the medical or dental provider of all medical and dental
care received by a foster child.
Four of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documentation of all
medical/dental appointments in the youth's file.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all the
following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
• (b) Child’s date of birth.
• (c) Available known information about the child’s
health.
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the
child.
• (e) All known emotional and psychological factors
relating to the care of the child.
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.
• (g) Circumstances necessitating placement or
replacement of the child.
• (h) Any other known information to enable the
foster parent to provide a stable, safe and health
environment for the foster child and the foster
family, including information about siblings who do
not reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
Two of eight foster care files reviewed did not contain documentation that all
information required within subsection a-h of this rule was provided to the caregivers
within the timeframes outlined within the rule.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

There was no technical assistance requested or required.

V. CONSULTATION
There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was 1 incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. Special evaluation 2024SEC0001901 was initiated on 9/12/2024 regarding
allegations a licensed foster parent slapped two foster youth in the face and pulled
them out of their room by their ears. The licensed foster parent was found to be in
violation of licensing rules and agency policy. A CAP was required and has since
been completed.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency renewal inspection was completed on 10/8/2024 and the CAP was
approved on 11/23/2024. The agency was cited for 15 violations, 3 of which were
repeated this year. Of those 3, there was an improvement in individual incidents of
non-compliance within all 3 of the violation areas. In 2023, 16 violations were
established, 6 of which were repeated this year. All the repeated violations remain
close to the same number of individual incidents of non-compliances. The agency
will need to establish additional corrective planning for the repeated violations to
ensure a reduction of incidents.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated staff turnover was a barrier to overall compliance during the review
period. In addition, the agency has experienced several placement crises that
become staff's priority over other case responsibilities. The assessment noted the
agency utilizes biweekly study hall which has had a positive impact. The chief
administrator indicated leadership will continue to review the corrective action
steps in place to ensure they are meeting compliance.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff via telephone. Staff reported feeling
supported by the agency. Supervisors and coworkers are available to assist as
5

needed. The agency does well providing updates with staff. Staff reported there is
a good work culture in the office and did not report any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and adoption services. All files were stored
securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The licensed foster home was found to lack a smoke detector in the
hallway of the sleeping area. In addition, a screen/barrier is needed for the wood
burning stove on the lower level.
Resolution: A smoke detector was installed. The agency provided a video showing
the location and that is it in working order. A barrier was put up around the wood
burning stove. The agency provided a picture of the barrier as verification.
Safety Alert #2: The licensed foster home was found to lack a smoke detector just
outside of foster parents' bedroom.
Resolution: The agency verified a smoke detector was installed by foster parents. A
picture was provided as verification.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
